definition[0]: someone who is in charge of official records of births, marriages, and deaths
definition[1]: an official of a college or university who deals with the running of the college
definition[2]: a hospital doctor who has finished his or her training but is of a lower rank than a consultant
definition[3]: the person whose duty is to record changes in the people who own the shares of a company. The registrar is usually someone who works for the company
example[0]: The Companies Act provides for registrars to give complete shareholder lists to persons on payment of a fee.
